page.title: 05LIFE FOR PARENTS
page.content: { Mothers. They cook (few convenience foods), sew, enter competions, drive, look after the children and take part in village life.In the survey only one had a degree; only six live in post 1960 houses. They live a temperate life, supporting their husbands in the farm way of life and most had children Quite a few go on holiday if only for a short time each year. Music plays quite a big part in their lives; they may sing in a choir, play the piano or encourage their family to take part in the local Eisteddfod or the Anniversary.(Surveyed at a WI meeting) { Fathers. The men did not have such diverse interests as the women, farming was their main concern. Clubs they joined, papers they read and social gatherings were all concerned with farming.
